interestingFact: India is home to the world's largest postal system, with over 150,000 post offices.
The United States has no official language, although English is the most widely spoken.
China has only one time zone despite spanning five geographical time zones.
Brazil is the only country in South America that speaks Portuguese.
Japan has more than 6,800 islands, with Honshu being the largest.
Russia is the largest country in the world, covering more than 11% of Earth’s land area.
Australia is home to more kangaroos than people.
Germany has over 1,500 different types of sausages.
Big Ben is actually the nickname of the bell inside the clock tower, not the tower itself.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world, spanning over 202,000 km.
